title: Tynemouth Walks

images.title: Robert Cutts from Bristol, England, UK, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Vice-Admiral Cuthbert Collingwood, 1st Baron Collingwood, (1748-1810) is chiefly remembered for his service to his country during the Napoleonic War. He was born at Newcastle-upon-Tyne 1748 and died in the Service of his country, on board of the “Ville de Paris” on 7th March 1810 and was buried in St Paul’s Cathedral. The four guns upon this monument belonged to his ship the “Royal Sovereign”. The monument is situated on the Spanish Battery, the headland that dominates the mouth of the River Tyne near Tynemouth.

images.title: Andrew Curtis / Long Sands, Tynemouth
images.caption: Long Sands,. The Castle and Priory ruins at Tynemouth can be seen on the left above the nearby Sharpness Point. The large, squat building on the nearby cliff top to the right houses the Toy Museum

description: This North Tyne town is a fine place for a historic coastal walk. There's splendid Georgian and Victorian architecture, an ancient priory and castle, and two lovely beaches to explore. This walk in the town takes you to the Spanish Battery and the Admiral Lord Collingworth Monument before heading out onto the North Pier for some great views of the town. You'll then explore Tynemouth Priory and Castle before heading along the coast to Sharpness Point, Long Sands, Tynemouth Park and North Point. You can start the walk from the Priory Haven Car Park or the Spanish Battery Car Park near the pier. Near the car parks you will also pass the Watch House Museum where you can learn all about the history of the local volunteer life brigade. Along the way there are splendid views of the dramatic castle ruins and the local beaches around Cullercoats Bay.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Gibraltar Rock is a nice place to stop off for some refreshments on the walk. The pub is located in an excellent spot with views to the coast and the priory. They have a popular carvery and also serve fine fish and chips. You can find them on East Street with a postcode of NE30 4EB for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The town marks the start of the River Tyne Trail an epic 80 mile route taking you along the river to Newcastle, Hexham, Haltwhistle and the source of the Tyne at Tyne Head, just south of Garrigill in the North Pennines.

display_address: Priors Haven Car Park, Pier Road, Tynemouth, North Tyneside, North East, England, NE30 4DB, United Kingdom
